botanical_details.genus: Begonia can be annuals, evergreen or deciduous perennials or shrubs, with fibrous, tuberous or rhizomatous roots and usually asymmetrical leaves, often strikingly patterned, and small or large flowers, both male and female in the same cluster
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Rex begonias are evergreen, rhizomatous perennials grown for their handsome, brightly coloured leaves, rather than the small pale pink or white flowers which may appear in spring, summer or autumn

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow under glass or in frost-free enviroment in light, well-drained netural to slightly acid loamless or loam-based potting compost (John Innes No.2) with shade from direct sun. See Begonias: houseplants for further advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by leaf cuttings or sections of rhizome
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to caterpillars, mealybugs, tarsonemid mite, thrips, vine weevil and aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey mould (Botrytis), stem rot, rhizome rot and powdery mildews
